outputs.output_descr:
The project aims to develop criteria for selecting study sites, identify alternative sustainable income generating activities and market analysis as well as provide information on sustainable charcoal. 
The project preparatory phase aims to conduct an assessment on reducing wood fuel consumption by tobacco industry and provide information gaps on Sustainable Land Management (SLM) practices, capacities and scale of impacts of SLM technologies and monitoring systems.  Funding from the preparatory grant will be used to conduct a detailed analysis on expected climate change, adaptation and mitigation measures for the pilot areas. In addition, Information on best practices and rehabilitation of dambos and degraded patches of land will also be sought. Funds will also be used to assess the capacity of institutions to implement recommended corrective and preventative measures, including a feasibility analysis and financial assessment of the full sized project

project_descr: Sustainable Forest Management in the Miombo Woodlands Resources of Western Tanzania
project_title: Sustainable Forest Management in the Miombo Woodland
